did.unittitle: Indiana University Dean of Students records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Indiana University. Dean of Students Office.

did.abstract: The office of the Dean of Students at Indiana University was created in 1945. The records span the period 1941-2000 and include annual reports, administrative and subject files primarily from the tenure of Dean Thomas Schreck.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Select files are closed to researchers. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative history
bioghist.p: Dean Clarence Edmondson was appointed the first Dean of Men in 1919. Prior to that, those duties were handled by the President and various other deans of the school. The office was organized primarily to take care of disciplinary matters and to help male students adjust to campus life. Activities of the Dean of Men's office at that time included: conferences with students on employment, misconduct, absences, admission on probation and deficiencies in grades, conferences with parents on scholarship, and conferences with heads of groups (i.e., fraternity presidents). In 1922, Charles Sembower was appointed as a second Dean of Men. Edmondson remained dean until 1944, Sembower until 1941. Similarly, the office of the Dean of Women was established in 1901 under the supervision of Mary Bidwell Breed, an assistant professor of Chemistry.

The Dean of Students position was created by the Board of Trustees in 1945 to head the newly-created Division of Student Personnel. The duties of the individual included the following: integrating the work of all offices concerned with student personnel problems, acting for the President in supervision of student government, and maintaining close associations with the student council and other organizations concerned with general problems of the student body. Col. Raymond L. Shoemaker, professor of Military Science, was appointed the first Dean of Students in 1946 and served in that capacity until 1955. He was followed by Robert H. Shaffer (1955-1969), and Thomas C. Schreck (1969-1981).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized in two series: Annual reports and Administrative and subject files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Dean of Students files consists primarily of the records of Thomas Schreck, Dean of Students from 1969-1981. The collection is organized into two series. The first series includes annual reports (1947-1979) of the Student Personnel Division, headed by the Dean of Students. Included in this series are reports from departments within that division which include the following: Counseling Office, Residence Halls, Student Health Service, Central Housing Office, YWCA, Veteran's Affairs, Reading & Study Clinic, Student Activities Office, Bureau of Measurement, Division of Scholarships and Loans, Student Employment, Student Legal Services, and the Career Center. The annual reports are those of Deans Raymond Shoemaker, Robert Shaffer and Schreck. The second series is an alphabetical arrangement of Administrative and subject files, primarily from Dean Schreckâs tenure. These include general administrative files on the budget and long-range planning, files on student service offices such as the Career Center, Learning Skills Center, Scholarships and Financial Aid, and Student Health Services as well as general files on student activities and organizations.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Dean of Students records, Collection C103, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

processinfo.head: Processing information
processinfo.p: Accession 2011/037 integrated in 2011 by Dina M. Kellams.
